intro: Galium glaberrimum, commonly known as smooth bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial herb native to North America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters during the summer months. Its smooth, glabrous stems and foliage are distinguishing features. Galium glaberrimum typically thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
